name: Planters Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Planters Inn June 23-27 for a romantic getaway. Upon checking in, we were warmly greeted by the doorman. (I should add that every time we departed or returned to the hotel, the doorman opened the door and addressed us by name).
reviews.title: very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The room was absolutely gorgeous. Clearly, hotel management pays attention to all details, because everything in the room was perfect. The room and bathroom were impeccably clean. We were in a room adjacent to the street. The shutters on the window blocked out all the light and almost all the street noise. We slept like babies.
reviews.title: Outstanding Choice in Chaleston

likes.disliked: — There is not anything I did not like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was also outstanding. A couple of times we called housekeeping, and they showed up almost immediately.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel w/ a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Planters Inn is a great 5 star hotel. My girlfriend surprised me with a weekend getaway for my birthday. The hotel has a classic upscale southern style with a friendly staff and wonderful restaurant (Peninsula Grill)
reviews.title: Upscale Southern Charm in a Prime Location

likes.liked: — Great location to main shopping street and historical downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This a Relais & Châteaux - Luxury hotel, and I was satisfied, but not blown away.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Not on par with pther Relais & Chateaux properties

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby lounge was comfortable and had coffee and apples. Wish they had tea or hot cocoa.
reviews.title: A refined, historic inn...

reviews.text: Room was in a separate building about 10 steps from the check-in and restaurant across a charming flowerbed brick pathway. Room was well-appointed with a 4-poster, very comfortable bed and linens. Turn down service, they leave a mint and next day's weather report on the bed.
reviews.title: Huge R&C disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Antique table, Desk and complimentary internet.
reviews.title: Oasis

reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for a while, but it seems I have lost track of time after our wedding.
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding at the Planters!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were married in the Planters Inn Courtyard and held our reception in the Courtyard and Garden Room at the Planters Inn. I can't say enough WONDERFUL things about our experience.
reviews.title: Went for just 1 night! Last Sat.

likes.disliked: — the room was a bit small (no biggie)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From beginning to end, it was a flawless few days. I was staying at another property in the days prior to the wedding, but since we were staying at the Planters for our wedding night, I wanted to get ready in our room at the Planters prior to the wedding. The staff was able to arrange a very early check-in on the day of the wedding which was exactly what I needed.
reviews.title: Superbly Managed/ Great Location/Tasteful Beautifully Designed Historic Rooms

likes.liked: — Management,service,historic accommodations and the restaurant--Peninsula Grill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Planters and Peninsula Grill went above and beyond at all times to make sure our day was perfect. The food from the Peninsula Grill was some of the best I have ever had....many guests are still raving about it!
reviews.title: Great location - nice hotel

reviews.text: There was chilled champagne waiting in the room upon check-in and another bottle was delivered after our wedding.
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty in Historical Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Planters Inn for 3 days/2 nights. While Charleston was hot (it is summer afterall), that did not diminish our stay. The staff made you feel like you were company in their home, not staying at a hotel. One night we were in the sitting room reading the paper and we struck up a conversation with one of the employees about homes in Charleston. He then went and found a magazine that had just arrived, and handed it to me. That shows caring and interest that goes above and beyond. Berthea was always smiling and pleasant. I wish I could recall all the names of everyone, but I cannot. Please know that all went above and beyond to provide excellent service.
reviews.title: Nothing could be finer than the Planters Inn

likes.liked: — The location and the professionalism of the staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was huge and beautifully appointed. The bath was very nice with plenty of room. Most importantly, we were treated like queens by the staff. Bertha at the concierge desk went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. We will definitely choose the Planters Inn again on our next visit. In addition to the wonderful staff - we had a fabulous meal at the Peninsula Grill; I just don't think it can be topped.
reviews.title: Perfect selection!

likes.liked: — The atmosphere ane the attention to detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much research, we decided to stay at the Planter's Inn and were absolutely thrilled with our choice. The staff was incredible and attended to any possible need. The hotel and courtyard were beautiful and well-maintained. Our room was spacious with an inviting piazza right outside its door. The marble bathroom was also spacious and included a whirlpool. Our stay was so relaxing and we felt very pampered. Breakfast in the beautiful couryard was a perfect way to start the day! We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — the quality of the bed, furniture, cleanliness of the hotel, everything was upscale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we exited our vehicle, we felt like royalty. The staff was extremely accomodating and the rooms were spectacular! The photos on the web site are exactly what you get...four poster bed, marble bathrooms, quiet rooms. This is by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. Be sure to eat breakfast at the hotel...the blackberries were enormous and delicious and the pastries light and fluffy. Kudos to everyone associated with this hotel.
reviews.title: First rate, all the way

description: Located in the very heart of historic Charleston, Planters Inn is a reflection of its unique location. From flickering carriage lanterns to locally woven Gullah sweetgrass baskets, the intimate 64-room Inn harmoniously blends Lowcountry inspiration and understated elegance. With its piazzas, palmetto-shaded courtyard, and distinctively residential details, Planters Inn is a polished homage to an authentic antebellum Charleston mansion and a AAA Four Diamond ranked property.Planters Inn is a member of Relais & Châteaux, the exclusive collection of hotels and restaurants located in romantic destinations around the world. The Inn’s blend of Southern hospitality and world class service extends to the acclaimed Peninsula Grill, where the award-winning cuisine, 17-year legacy of being “the” place to celebrate a milestone event, and famous Ultimate Coconut Cake® have made it a Charleston institution.
